paragraphs.content: Psalm 105
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 105

paragraphs.content: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O give thanks unto the Lord; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

paragraphs.content: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

paragraphs.content: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seek the Lord, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

paragraphs.content: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

paragraphs.content: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

paragraphs.content: He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

paragraphs.content: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

paragraphs.content: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

paragraphs.content: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

paragraphs.content: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

paragraphs.content: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

paragraphs.content: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

paragraphs.content: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

paragraphs.content: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

paragraphs.content: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

paragraphs.content: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

paragraphs.content: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

paragraphs.content: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Until the time that his word came: the word of the Lord tried him.

paragraphs.content: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

paragraphs.content: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

paragraphs.content: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

paragraphs.content: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

paragraphs.content: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

paragraphs.content: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

paragraphs.content: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

paragraphs.content: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

paragraphs.content: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

paragraphs.content: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

paragraphs.content: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

paragraphs.content: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

paragraphs.content: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

paragraphs.content: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

paragraphs.content: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,
paragraphs.contentHtml: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

paragraphs.content: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

paragraphs.content: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

paragraphs.content: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

paragraphs.content: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

paragraphs.content: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

paragraphs.content: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

paragraphs.content: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

paragraphs.content: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

paragraphs.content: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

paragraphs.content: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

paragraphs.content: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the Lord.
